unnormalised: Just FYI, "Hav." stands for Havildar, a non-commissioned officer in the Indian Army. Above Hav., you have "Naik" and then "Lance Naik" before you get to commissioned ranks. "Capt." is Captain, a commissioned officer, and "Maj. Gen." is Major General, a pretty high-ranking officer. Remember that "Wg. Cdr." is Wing Commander in the Indian Air Force, equivalent to a Lieutenant Colonel in the Army. Also, sometimes people abbreviate "Brigadier" to "Brig.", so don't get confused. These abbreviations are commonly used in official documents and casual conversation, so itâ€™s good to know them!
normalised: Just for your information, "Havildar" stands for Havildar, a non-commissioned officer in the Indian Army. Above Havildar, you have "Naik" and then "Lance Naik" before you get to commissioned ranks. "Captain" is Captain, a commissioned officer, and "Major General" is Major General, a pretty high-ranking officer. Remember that "Wing Commander" is Wing Commander in the Indian Air Force, equivalent to a Lieutenant Colonel in the Army. Also, sometimes people abbreviate "Brigadier" to "Brigadier", so don't get confused. These abbreviations are commonly used in official documents and casual conversation, so it is good to know them!
